summary: How does the federal judiciary know when it needs a new courthouse? Every year, it scores the more than 400 courthouses nationwide on how they meet security, space, building condition, and functionality standards. Then, the cities that have courthouses are ranked by urgency to choose locations for new courthouse construction. The judiciary ensures accurate scoring at the time of its assessment, but we found that...
title: Federal Courthouse Construction: Judiciary Should Refine Its Methods for Determining Which Projects Are Most Urgent
